fields.description: The _Latest Activity_ column on the users table is too narrow.
fields.summary: Users table needs wider columns (IE7)

fields.description: On a user's page (e.g., /crucible/cru/abuttfield) the usernames and repos in the 'Committer Mappings' section in the sidebar are misaligned.
fields.summary: Committer mappings misaligned on user page (IE7)
git slurping fails when in the face of Unicode Line Separator chars

fields.description:
a) the old changelog/~rss/ should redirect to the new activity stream rss feed (preserving as may params as possible)
b) the RSS item in the tools menus should direct-link to RSS instead of the RSS dialog
c) the exiting RSS/Email dialog should be deleted
d) the old changelog/~rss/ functionality should be dropped
fields.summary: Rationalise RSS in Fisheye
Native JavaHL can return null change paths in a log message call

fields.description:
Customers need to set their SVN URL to be the repository root and the PATH when defining their repository and if they get this wrong we give an error message like "Repository URL blah does not match URL returned from repository: REPOSITORY ROOT". (NOTE this is only if they test the repo. In many cases they may not test te URL). 

If we can determine the Repository root, then we should set this as the SVN URL and the path as everything else for the customers.
fields.summary: Automatically set the SVN URL and PATH for subversion repositories

fields.description:
the old branch visualisation is no longer available in the 2.0 UI. Add it back. 

look at the possibility of rendering it clientside supported by JSON data from the server.
fields.summary: the branch visualisation is no longer available - add it back

fields.description: see screenshot - checkboxes on the right are misaligned
fields.summary: Alignment issue with Firefox 3 on Ubuntu 9
Quicknav results include other users' starred quicksearches

fields.description: see screenshot
fields.summary: Missing icons in Quicknav

fields.description: "Issue Type: 3" should be "Issue Type: Improvement" or whatever.
fields.summary: Show issue type text in JIRA popup

fields.description: ie - they shouldn't be hidden on a document.ready call.
fields.summary: Hidden directories and files should be hidden on page load

fields.description: Copying a Lucene index over another one can result in a corrupt index - See FE-1654.
fields.summary: Restore task should ensure that Lucene indexes are restored to a clean directory
Admin Support

fields.description: The initial page load doesn't show the current settings (see screenshot) it *does* show them if you change them.
fields.summary: Ticks missing from FishEye Diff View Menu
Store Diff should be optional for CVS repositories
Long commit messages on revision page should be hidden
diff stars are missing from the UI

fields.description: The most active committers determination can be expensive and is currently being calculates for the main repo activity page. Make this an Ajax request only calculated on demand
fields.summary: Ajaxify most active committers display

fields.description:
Provide more visibility into user activity:
# When was the last time a user has logged in
# Number of total logins
# Admin action audit trail
fields.summary: Provide Audit trail

fields.description: There is a typo error. See the attached screen shot
fields.summary: Typo error
Binary File detection
Store file mode info

fields.description: In a JIRA hover, when you click the down arrow to show more details, the labels for the fields in that section flash then hide.
fields.summary: JIRA hover field labels flash then hide (IE7)

fields.description:
This originates from [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1864].

THE Fisheye LDAP logs and JIRA LDAP logs shows that with Fisheye we have an ABANDON AND CMP operation during the authentication, which the are wasted operations.

{noformat}
Fisheye:
=========

[02/Jun/2009:04:43:08 +0100] conn=38051 op=0 msgId=1 - BIND
dn="uid=USERNAME,ou=People,o=Administrators,dc=atlassian,dc=com" method=128 version=3
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:08 +0100] conn=38051 op=0 msgId=1 - RESULT err=0 tag=97 nentries=0 etime=0
dn="uid=USERNAME,ou=people,o=administrators,dc=atlassian,dc=com"
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:08 +0100] conn=38051 op=1 msgId=2 - SRCH
base="ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com" scope=2 filter="(uid=USER)" attrs="uid "
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:08 +0100] conn=38051 op=1 msgId=2 - RESULT err=0 tag=101 nentries=1 etime=0
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:08 +0100] conn=38051 op=2 msgId=3 - ABANDON targetop=NOTFOUND msgid=2
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:09 +0100] conn=38051 op=3 msgId=4 - BIND
dn="uid=USER,ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com" method=128 version=3
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:09 +0100] conn=38051 op=3 msgId=4 - RESULT err=0 tag=97 nentries=0 etime=0
dn="uid=USER,ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com"
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:09 +0100] conn=38051 op=4 msgId=5 - CMP
dn="uid=USER,ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com" attr="uid"
[02/Jun/2009:04:43:09 +0100] conn=38051 op=4 msgId=5 - RESULT err=6 tag=111 nentries=0 etime=0

While in JIRA, they would get:

Jira Logs:
===========

[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098008 op=0 msgId=1 - BIND
dn="uid=USERNAME,ou=People,o=Administrators,dc=atlassian,dc=com" method=128 version=3
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098008 op=0 msgId=1 - RESULT err=0tag=97 nentries=0 etime=0
dn="uid=USERNAME,ou=people,o=administrators,dc=atlassian,dc=com"
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098008 op=1 msgId=2 - SRCH
base="ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com" scope=2 filter="(uid=USER)" attrs="uid"
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098008 op=1 msgId=2 - RESULT err=0 tag=101 nentries=1 etime=0
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098009 op=-1 msgId=-1 - fd=195 slot=195 LDAP connection from 137.34.121.95 to 169.49.236.148
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098009 op=0 msgId=1 - BIND
dn="uid=USER,ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com" method=128 version=3
[19/May/2009:05:32:47 -0400] conn=1098009 op=0 msgId=1 - RESULT err=0 tag=97 nentries=0 etime=0
dn="uid=USER,ou=people,dc=csfb,dc=atlassian,dc=com"
{noformat}
fields.summary: Improve LDAP Authentication so it does not Abandon initial bind or do an CMP

fields.description: The people tab should only be highlighted on the root people list and user/committer pages not the user lists within a repo. see screenshot.
fields.summary: Source not People tab on repo constrained user lists

fields.description:
Issues are currently only shown at the root of a repository, yet we always render an issues toggle. 

The issues toggle should only be shown at the root.
fields.summary: Don't show issues toggle when issues are not available

fields.description: Use the standard RSS icon (or whatever confluence uses).
fields.summary: Use standard RSS icon

fields.description: When I complete a review I want to go straight to the next one I have to do rather than back to the dashboard.
fields.summary: Show relevant reviews in complete dialog

fields.description: it should select the revision that you came from, instead it selects the latest revision
fields.summary: clicking Revisions from a diff or annotation page selects the wrong revision

fields.description: There are 4 things in this box (see attach) latest activity, stats box, follow and mapped users - they need to be aligned/formatted more uniformly.
fields.summary: Side bar stats styling

fields.description:
When I get an email from Crucible about a comment, it looks like this:
!http://img.skitch.com/20090610-ck4r92b969xpte83kx6dyc7fjn.jpg!

I click the link, and then go to the review, and then have to click through all the comments to find that one. - or need to copy and paste into a web browser.

The old "Expand All Commented" used to make this easier. Now that button is gone, there is no easy to find the comment.
Can the #anchor be replaced with a ?parameter, so Mail.app will hyperlink it correctly.
fields.summary: Make comment id links in email a parameter, not an anchor so Mail.app links it correctly.
Better handling of Source tab link for deleted files.

fields.description: This is due to incorrect settings for project constraints on activity items. Alter the builder such that it automatically adds repository constraints for projects to avoid future confusion.
fields.summary: Project List Page has incorrect activity data
activity stream sporadically display a wrong author for a commit activity item

fields.description: Put back accidentally removed activity calendar, make into an ajax-called component and fix styling
fields.summary: Put back activity calendar

fields.description: If you go to a URL with a permalink, e.g., {{http://localhost/crucible/cru/CR-FE-333/#c123}} and are not logged in, clicking 'Log In' preserves the {{http://localhost/crucible/cru/CR-FE-333/}} part of the URL, but not the {{#c123}}. So after you log in, you go to that review but not that comment.
fields.summary: Redirect to login doesn't preserve the URL anchor
When the Tools menu is empty it should be disabled
Exception during content indexing halts indexing

fields.description:
1. View a review on which you are an uncompleted reviewer
2. Get another reviewer to add a comment
3. Click 'Complete' -- you are shown a dialog indicating that there are unread comments.
4. Click 'view unread comments'
5. No files are shown, as the page doesn't contain the new comment.

We need to either not check the server for new comments, or update the page with the new comments when the user asks to see them.
fields.summary: Unread comments are detected on 'Complete', but then not displayed

fields.description:
p4 Branches, labels and jobs are global for a p4 server, so if fisheye has multiple p4 repositories defined that all come from the same server, they should be shared amongst the repositories, preventing the need to duplicate the information and elongate the scan time. 

From [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-1918]
fields.summary: p4 Branches, labels and jobs should be shared across repositories from the same server
Git annotations are in reverse order (i.e. the next/previous links are inverted)
Don't reload FishEye user prefs when changing an option
Git chart support
Git diff text caching
Git tag support

fields.description: Null Pointer Exception when FishEye uses native JavaHL
fields.summary: FishEye fails with native JavaHL

fields.description: The {{http://host/crucible/profile/showWatches.do}} URL is linked to directly from notification emails, but since this now lives in a dialog, clicking the link directly renders it as a full page.
fields.summary: Deep links to "FE Watches" renders the settings dialog as a full page

fields.description: Changing profile settings such as "Unified/Side-By-Side Diffs" and "Softwrapping" are frequently lost after some time and revert back to their original or default setting. I think I also got different settings at my home pc than at the office (suggesting session-scope persistency?).
fields.summary: Profile settings not presistent

fields.description:
New installation, one repo, only the admin user could even exist

http://localhost:8060/admin/userAdmin.do

"Displaying users 1 to 0 of 0."
fields.summary: Silly user count

fields.description:
As I tried to view diff between 2 revisions of a file (contains few long lines), the Display Preferences > Soft Wrapping is not working. After I tried to select *Soft Wrapping*, it reverted back to value *No Wrapping*. As a result, I need to scroll horizontally to view the diff, especially when I pick *Side-by-Side Diffs*.

The soft wrap is not working well in version 1.6.6 either. It works fine for certain files, but sometimes fail.
fields.summary: Soft Wrap doesn't work well all the time

fields.description:
Navigating to: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE/?cs=36959654 fails with a 500 because the changeset doesn't exist.
This can also happen when the repo is re-slurping and the changeset does exist in the repo, but isn't yet known to FishEye.
fields.summary: Specifying a changeset that doesn't exist, FE gives a 500

fields.description: for example, this page http://fisheye6.atlassian.com/users/wicket , there are committers who have 'no activity' listed despite http://fisheye6.atlassian.com/committer/wicket/jdonnerstag showing otherwise.
fields.summary: committers displayed under the user list always have no latest activity if they are not mapped to a user

fields.description:
Using the EditLicenseAction to paste an updated license string that happens to contain an ampersand, causes FE to double-escape the string when writing to the config.xml file and then it's no longer able to read the license, giving a 500 internal server error on every page:

{noformat}
ERROR - /static/kke5xx/2static/images/search_round_rightlabel.png
java.lang.NullPointerException
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.license.LicenseInfo.isTerminated(LicenseInfo.java:47)

   at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1200)
   at com.cenqua.fisheye.web.filters.ProductInfoFilter.doFilter(ProductInfoFilter.java:36)
   at org.mortbay.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler$Chain.doFilter(ServletHandler.java:1200)
   at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.IteratingFilterChain.doFilter(IteratingFilterChain.java:46)
   at com.atlassian.plugin.servlet.filter.ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.doFilter(ServletFilterModuleContainerFilter.java:55)

fields.description:
https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/qsearch?q=star

When you try to star a Quick Search the hover appears on the first click, rather than the second.
fields.summary: Star hover appears on first click on Quick Search

fields.description:
http://img.skitch.com/20090527-mb77c7wf3thyfi3jpmfusct7q6.png

Pete wants to add an icon to the Quick Search results to support filtering results like comment:test where comments only are returned. Currently this content is being reported as a changeset - which may be a catch-all - and so is showing the changeset icon.
fields.summary: Increase granularity of Quick Search results to include other content types

fields.description:
Users complain about perfromance issues, and looking at the thread dumps, a number of threads are waiting to lock a monitor that is being held by an RSS feed. (see screenshot)

Looking at the debug logs to see how long the requests are taking:

{noformat}
---------------------------------------------------------------
Took 337
2009-05-26 10:20:10,456 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - start request /changelog/%7Erss/Repo/rss.xml nosession
2009-05-26 10:20:11,047 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.app ActionDispatcherServlet-doIt - mapped action changelog to class com.cenqua.fisheye.web.ChangelogServlet pi = /~rss/Repo/rss.xml
2009-05-26 10:20:11,124 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.app ActionDispatcherServlet-doIt - pi: Repo rss.xml rss
2009-05-26 10:20:11,144 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-acquire - acquire engine on Repo, count=1
2009-05-26 10:20:11,151 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-acquire - acquire engine on Repo, count=2
2009-05-26 10:20:11,156 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-release - release engine on Repo, count=1

2009-05-26 10:25:47,494 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf RepositoryHandle-release - release engine on Repo, count=2
2009-05-26 10:25:47,494 DEBUG [btpool0-46] fisheye.perf UpfrontFilter-logRequest - end request /changelog/%7Erss/Repo/rss.xml sessionid=4fgr66ebnz7f

---------------------------------------------------------------
---------------------------------------------------------------

{noformat}

We see that findRecentChangeSets and rendering is taking a long time. findRecentChangeSets is most likely the suspect for holding onto the lock on the inifinitydb. 

We need to investigate and reduce the time taken for these requests.
fields.summary: Processing Rss feeds for large repositories are slow and cause performance issues for other user threads as they hold locks on the cache.

fields.description:
The error that is thrown is:

{noformat}
2009-05-26 11:41:39,524 ERROR [btpool0-601] org.mortbay.log sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl-invoke0 - Nested in javax.servlet.ServletException: java.lang.NullPointerException:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.cenqua.crucible.actions.create.CreateReviewFromChangesetAction.execute(CreateReviewFromChangesetAction.java:147)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
{noformat}

Steps to reproduce

1) Log out of Crucible completely 
2) Go into a JIRA issue and from the fisheye tab attempt to create a review via the "Create crucible review  for all x changesets in" link. 
3) You will be directed to the crucible login page 
4) Enter your details and when you click submit, you will get a 500 error NullPointerException and if you check your fisheye-error.log you will see the above error 
5) Repeat step two and this time it will succeed as you are logged in. 

What is happening is the post parameters that are sent to Crucible are lost when you are redirected to login. Once you login, crucible attempts to redirect to the action you were trying to do before logging in, however without the post parameters you first passed. 

I.E. 

JIRA Issue > Create Review > Redirect to Crucible Login > Successful login > Redirect back to Create Review 

The post parameters passed from JIRA Issue > Create Review are not passed on, or lost between Successful login > Redirect back to Create Review.
fields.summary: NPE thrown when creating a review from JIRA when not logged into Crucible as post parameters are not passed on after you are redirected to Login

fields.description:
At present this code is scattered about actions and the DefaultReviewService and the CommentManager.
I think all the event sending and notification sending should be done in CommentManager -- and do we really need the PublishEventCallback stuff?
fields.summary: Refactor event and notification sending for comments

fields.description: Sometimes RSS feeds can cause performance issues, and it would be to provide a way to disable RSS feeds should the customer wish to.
fields.summary: Allow an option to disable RSS feeds like you can disable watches

fields.description:
When diffs are indexed, files are created in the {{FISHEYE_INST/var/data/DiffTextCache}} directory. 

We should introduce an option to disable the indexing of these for customers who only want the bare minimum.
fields.summary: Add option to disable the indexing of diffs

fields.description:
If the Fisheye instance is broken (which occurs often on a large Fisheye instance), and in a state where all pages return slowly (A restart tends to temporary fix this), the Jira integration will cause Jira pages to time out when viewing Fisheye history, or the All history tab.

There needs to be a way for Jira to ping Fisheye and make sure it does not go down when Fisheye is down.

Also, if the crucible instance is down, it is impossible to deconfigure a crucible link in Jira. The only thing you can do is disable the plugin.
fields.summary: Crucible/Fisheye-Jira Plugin breaks Jira when Crucible/Fisheye is down

Created from crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1878#17185
fields.summary: Ajax dialog links should have an href instead of just javascript

fields.description:
h3. Problem

This issue blocks [https://studio.atlassian.com/browse/JST-1400]

It would be nice to be able to specify permissions on a path-level basis. For example, if I had a repository set up with directories "trunk", "private", "branches", and "tags", I should be able to specify that only people in the "admins" and "developers" groups can access the private directory, but everyone can view the other directories.
h3. Workaround

Create several repositories in Fisheye - each pointing to the same source repository.

In each of them configure proper include/exclude paths, reflecting permissions set up in the source repository. 

In each of them configure permissions, granting access to proper users/groups, reflecting permissions from the source repository. 

This way you can create "repository views" in Fisheye.
fields.summary: path-level permissions
Typing return in the Edit Review dialog produces a blank page

fields.description: Creating a review from FishEye's annotation or diff view results in an NPE in the resulting create review dialog page when you need to select a project for the review.
fields.summary: Creating a review from annotation or diff results in NPE

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*:
# Setup LDAP authentication.
# Select option *Users must be added to FishEye manually* for property *Auto-add*
# Select option *Yes* for property *Synchronise users with LDAP*
# Enter shorter *Synchronise Period* (e.g. 1 minute)
# Wait for the next sync, and users from LDAP will be added to FishEye users automatically (shall be manually).
fields.summary: LDAP Authentication: Turn on Sync and manually add user cannot work together

fields.description:
See: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1874/#c17122

Must be possible to disable/reconfigure the link to avoid interfering with other applications unintentionally. Maybe as a bundled plugin?
fields.summary: Make Intellij icon configurable

fields.description:
We can create Advanced linkers. However the current docs do not give any examples. See [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Linkers]. 

There is a brief example at [http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257307379&#257307379] but it would be good to have docs explaining how users could create their own advanced linkers.
fields.summary: Document Advanced Linkers

fields.description:
I copied the original meesage from user to avoid any missing while deliver the message. 

{quote}
I have posted a (xmltidy) of two repositories that are used by the same team.

Two separate projects in Perforce:

    * //depot/betw
    * //depot/agw

When displayed in fisheye files are displayed as (example):

/flow/src/config.xml

If both repostories have a config.xml file you will see the following in Jira:

/flow/src/config.xml
/flow/src/config.xml

There is no way to tell which file is from with depot in Perforce.

A simple solution would be to have the option to always display the full path for files in Fisheye / Crucible / Jira so that the differences are obvious:

//depot/betw/flow/src/config.xml
//depot/agw/flow/src/config.xml

*This issue is more likely to affect company that have teams work on multiple source branches at the same time.* It becomes more of an issue as each area many have standardized ANT Build templates, IVY repository store information... standardized configuration naming procedure.

In one case for a new system being developed, every project has 10+ files similarly named for automatic building by an CI system. These files appear "identical" if the changes are being tracked through Jira or through other products that get data out-of Fisheye.
{quote}

*Suggested Way to Improve*:
* Show the full path of each file (include the repo name)
fields.summary: Show the full path of file to avoid confusion
Support slashes in filename searches
